newsitem.title: USA: Ameritech proposes rate cut for Illinois.
newsitem.headline: Ameritech proposes rate cut for Illinois.

text.p: Ameritech Corp said Tuesday it proposed $38.9 million in rate reductions for Illinois consumers and businesses under a plan filed with the Illinois Commerce Commission.
The latest proposed reductions are part of a broader plan approved in 1994 by the Illinois Commerce Commission which provides more flexible regulatory framework in exchange for price caps.
If approved, the reductions will take effect in July, the company said.

Residential fees will be cut by $20.5 million with the biggest reductions for local calls 15 miles away or less. Ameritech is also reducing the monthly charge for residential Caller ID with name to $8.00 a month from $8.50, and the discount for purchasing Caller ID with an additional service like Call Waiting will be increased to $0.90 from $0.70 a month, the company said.
Ameritech said rate reductions for businesses will total $11.8 million, and $6.6 million in cuts goes to cellular service companies for charges they pay to connect calls to Ameritech's landlines.
